pop_up: Empee is a London fabric supplier with a large range of materials, including cottons, silks, wools, linens and upholstery fabrics. People often use it for its broad selection and trade-friendly prices. The space has a straightforward, warehouse-style feel rather than a boutique atmosphere.
more_info: Empee began as a wholesale textile supplier and still operates mainly in that mode, holding a very large volume of stock at its London warehouse. The range covers everyday fabrics like cotton, jersey and denim, alongside silks, suiting, upholstery and production-ready materials. Reviews often mention that pricing is reasonable for bulk or trade use, and that the experience is practical and no-frills. Customers who visit regularly tend to be students, small brands and makers who need reliable stock levels without boutique mark-ups, though some note that the scale of the warehouse means service can feel functional rather than personalised.

pop_up: Woolcrest is a long-running East London shop with a huge range of dress and furnishing fabrics, from basics to heavier wools. People often come for the variety and good value, especially on cottons and prints. Reviews on service differ, but most agree the pricing is fair for the quality.
more_info: Woolcrest began in the early 1980s, founded by a refugee who started out selling leftover factory fabrics around the East End before gradually growing into a full wholesale-to-retail business. The Hackney shop now operates as a large, family-run warehouse with shelves stacked high in cottons, wools, upholstery cloth and seasonal fabrics. Customers often describe it as a 'go-to' spot for both range and affordability, especially for cottons and printed fabrics, and many regulars rely on the store because they can buy larger quantities without high mark-ups. Reviews mention the service as straightforward and sometimes brisk, but the selection and pricing usually outweigh that for people who prioritise choice and value over a boutique setting.

Initial consultations are offered, and fittings are available during opening hours.

name: Forest Digital
pop_up: Forest Digital is a textile printing and production service specialising in digital fabric printing, sampling and small-run manufacturing
more_info: Operating from the UK, this service provider works with designers, brands and studios to print custom artwork onto fabric bases, handle small-batch manufacturing of scarves, home-ware, apparel and accessories. They emphasise high-quality inks, a wide variety of fabric bases (including silks and natural fibres), and flexibility for short runs or custom projects.

name: The Button Queen
pop_up: The Button Queen is a specialist shop entirely devoted to buttonsfrom tailoring sizes and horn buttons to vintage and decorative pieces. The focus is distinct and dedicated.
more_info: Operating for decades, The Button Queen is recognised for its extensive collection spanning horn, shell, metal, blazer-sized and rare vintage buttons. Tailors, costume-makers and designers frequently praise the depth of selection and the ability to source rare or bespoke button styles. The service is specialist and button-centricif your garment hinges on its closure hardware, this is the go-to.

name: Linton Tweeds
pop_up: Linton Tweeds offers couture-woven tweeds, boucls and fancy weaves online, focused on high-quality cloth rather than basic fabrics.
more_info: Linton Tweeds has over a century of experience manufacturing fine woven tweeds and boucl fabrics, now selling collections online with worldwide delivery. Their fabrics appeal to designers, couture makers and interior specialists rather than hobby-sewers buying commodity cloth. Some sale listings show dramatic drops (e.g., tweeds reduced to ~20/m in end-of-line events).

name: Barnett Lawson Trimmings
pop_up: Barnett Lawson is an online trimmings retailer offering a large catalogue of fringes, tassels, cords, braids and decorative pieces.
more_info: With a long history in the trimming trade, Barnett Lawson now operates mainly online and is known for its classical and decorative trims used in costume, interiors, millinery and embellishment work. The catalogue includes items not often found in general haberdashery shops, and its popular with designers who need detailed or ornamental finishes.

name: Contour Atelier
pop_up: Contour Atelier is an online warehouse for luxury contour and lingerie fabrics and suppliesfrom lace and mesh to hardware and exclusive kits.
more_info: This site offers fabrics and supplies tailored for lingerie, swimwear, finely made contemporary contour garments and accessories. Their catalog includes items like 24 K gold plated hardware, French lace, Swiss embroidery, powermesh, and fabrics priced from lower tiers (e.g., tulle from ~4) up to premium finishes. The business is oriented toward makers who work at a specialist level rather than casual sewers.

name: Bratastic Fabrics
pop_up: Bratastic Fabrics is an online store focused on lingerie-making supplies, fabrics and kits rather than general dress textiles.
more_info: Bratastic serves makers of bras and intimate apparel with fabrics, elastics, pre-cut kits and instruction sessions; for example users mention dream lingerie supplies and supportive service for bra-making beginners. The shop only ships in the UK but has a strong niche appeal for anyone working in lingerie design or sewing.

name: Vena Cava
pop_up: Vena Cava Design is an online supplier specialising in corsetry, tailoring fabrics and costume-making materials, rather than everyday dress fabrics.
more_info: Operating since the late 1990s, Vena Cava Design serves home sewists, costume makers and specialist dressmakers with fabrics like coutil, duchess satin, powernet, boning and corset interlinings. Their range includes strong technical fabrics (for structure) alongside decorative finishes, and their stock often appeals to users working in niche or historical costume work. Customers value the specialist nature but note that browsing is online-centric rather than a bricks-and-mortar browsing experience.

name: Renee Materials
pop_up: Rene Materials is a material reuse marketplace offering surplus fabrics, yarns, textiles and leather for makers, with a sustainability angle.
more_info: Rene sources excess materials and off-cuts and makes them available to creatives and students, emphasising reuse and circular design. The offering includes yarn bundles, fabric off-cuts and material scrap for crafting, which makes it relevant for knitters, textile artists and embroidery-makers exploring experimental or budget-friendly materials.

name: Yeoman - Yarn
pop_up: Yeoman Yarns is an online shop selling hand-knitting and machine-knitting yarns, patterns and accessories.
more_info: The company offers a wide selection of yarns in different fibres and weights, including cotton, wool, acrylic blends and occasional luxury mixes. Users note that the site is practical for ordering larger cones or specific colours for home or small-scale making. The shop also provides shade cards and pattern options, which helps when planning projects or matching yarn types.

name: Handweavers Studio
pop_up: Handweavers Studio is a specialist supplier of yarns, fibres and weaving materials, with tools and classes for makers working in textile craft.
more_info: The shop carries a broad range of fibres and yarns for weaving, spinning and felting, along with looms, tools and equipment. Customers mention that the stock includes both standard fibres and more unusual materials, and that the space supports those exploring weaving or textile craft in a hands-on way. The studio also runs courses for beginners and experienced makers, creating a steady mix of learning and practical supply in one place.

name: Kleins Haberdashery
pop_up: Kleins Haberdashery is an online haberdashery and trimmings supplier offering buttons, ribbons, zips and sewing accessories for hobbyists and makers.
more_info: While detailed current information is not abundant, the retailer is known within online sewing communities as a go-to for trimmings and haberdashery items, giving makers access to accessories and small-quantity supplies alongside basic cloth.

name: Top Fabric
pop_up: Top Fabric is an online retailer offering a large catalogue of fabrics (over 20,000 styles) including dress-, suit- and home-textile cloths, with international shipping and student discounts.
more_info: Top Fabric emphasises choice, stock and flexibility: customers can buy in 10 cm increments, request swatches, and make volume orders if needed. The site states it supports student discounts and international delivery. Their positioning is broad: makers, small brands, students and interior users.

name: J Wood Leather
pop_up: J Wood Leathers is a family-run leather merchant and wholesaler offering hides, skins and leathercraft materials online, suitable for makers and small-scale manufacturers.
more_info: Based in West Yorkshire and supplying globally, J Wood provides a large selection of leather types including full grain sides, vegetable-tanned hides, metallic finishes, hair-on hides and upholstery leathers. The website notes that stock is fully supported and hides can be ordered online with delivery, making the company accessible for home makers, designers and smaller producers. Customers appreciate the breadth of choice and the availability of stock lots or special-offer sections for craft-friendly users.

name: A & A Crack & Sons - Leather
pop_up: A & A Crack & Sons is a UK-based specialist leather supplier offering a wide range of hides, skins and associated materials for production, craft and luxury use.
more_info: With over 35 years experience, A & A Crack supplies leather including vegetable-tanned, chrome-tanned, suedes, hair-on hides and embossed finishes. Their offering spans applications from bags, belts, footwear, upholstery and accessories. The company also provides services like splitting, embossing and colour-matching so users can tailor the leather to their project. Feedback notes the depth of stock, with both artisan-scale skins and production-volume panels available, and many makers value the combination of materials and services in one place.

name: Lyon Leather
pop_up: Lyon Leathers is an online and factory-based supplier of leather hides, skins and related hardware, catering to makers, shoemakers, bag-makers and production use.
more_info: Established in 1990 and family-run, Lyon Leathers supplies a wide stock of leather hides (vegetable-tanned, chrome-tanned), hair-on hides, suedes, and associated hardware such as buckles, rivets and straps. They serve belt, bag, accessory, leather-goods production as well as individual crafters, and information shows hidden stock types and pricing across website categories.

name: SOJO
pop_up: SOJO is a clothing repairs and tailoring platform that offers alterations and repair services via online booking, with options for collection and delivery across London.
more_info: SOJO is a fashion-tech platform offering alterations and clothing repairs through an online or app-based booking system. Customers can request tailoring or repair services via the SOJO website or app; garments are collected from the customers address or dropped off at a designated location and then returned after work is completed, typically within a week. SOJO also operates physical service points, including a concession at Selfridges in London, where fittings and consultations can be booked. The platform works with an in-house team of tailors for a range of alterations and repairs on everyday and formal garments.

name: Zerow
pop_up: Zerow is an online fabric shop specialising in deadstock and surplus textiles sourced from fashion and interior industries.
more_info: Zerow is an online fabric and leather supplier based in Scandicci (Florence), Italy. The company selects and sells high-quality deadstock fabrics and leathers recovered from the stocks of Italian and international luxury fashion brands. Zerows range includes fashion and accessory textiles offered in limited quantities due to their reclaimed nature. The business also operates a showroom and atelier space in Scandicci where designers and artisans can explore materials and circular fashion concepts.

name: Knopf Budke
pop_up: Knopf Budke is a specialist button supplier offering a wide range of buttons for garment production and repair.
more_info: Knopf Budke is a specialist button supplier based in Germany, operating primarily as an online retailer. The company supplies buttons and garment fastenings for fashion, tailoring, and manufacturing use, with a broad range covering functional and decorative styles. Stock is geared toward designers, tailors, and producers sourcing components for garment construction, repairs, or small-scale production.

name: Nova Kaeru - Leather
address: Trs Rios, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
pop_up: Nova Kaeru Exotic Leather supplies sustainable exotic and bio-leathers, including fish-based leather, from its facility in Brazil.
more_info: Nova Kaeru Exotic Leather is a leather supplier based in Estrada de So Joaquim, Bemposta, Trs Rios, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The company specialises in sustainable and organic leather production, with a focus on exotic materials such as pirarucu fish leather and other bio-tanned hides. Nova Kaeru sources and processes leather using organic tanning methods that avoid harmful heavy metals, and works with local cooperatives in the Amazon region on sustainable raw material practices. Its range of materials is suitable for fashion, accessories, and design applications, reflecting a combination of traditional techniques and technological processes.
